text.text_translated: If we are aware of differences in expectations and behaviour, we can avoid miscommunication. We should also remember that cultural stereotypes can harm business relationships. National cultures can shape how we act and think. We are influenced by our region, the groups we belong to, our age, our gender, our company culture and our own experiences. Therefore, we should keep these differences in mind and not use them to put all the people of one nation in the same box.

feedback.feedback: Your output preserves all original facts and key relationships and meets the CEFR B1 requirement. The meaning is clear, and technical vocabulary has been simplified appropriately. To enhance cohesion and sentence variety, introduce more linking words such as although, however, or but rather than relying on only short sentences. For example, you could combine “National cultures can shape how we act and think” with the previous idea using “Although national cultures can shape how we act and think, we are also influenced by our region, our company culture and our own experiences.” Finally, consider adding a brief definition or example of “cultural stereotypes” to ensure full comprehension for B1 readers. These changes will improve flow and reader engagement while keeping the language accessible.
